snippet: The wheels of the machinery of death in Georgia keep turning, greased by a strict federal law that prevents prisoners from filing multiple appeals.
abstract: Editorial calls on Supreme Court to stay execution for Warren Lee Hill Jr, Georgia man who will soon be executed for murder; argues that under breathtakingly strict federal law, Lee has been barred from filing additional appeals despite expert testimony that he is mentally retarded.
lead_paragraph: The wheels of the machinery of death in Georgia keep turning, greased by a strict federal law that prevents prisoners from filing multiple appeals.
